info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 18 at 4:37PM EDT until July 18 at 7:45PM EDT by NWS Jackson KY
info.description:
* WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected.
* WHERE...A portion of east central Kentucky, including the following counties, Bath and Montgomery.
* WHEN...Until 745 PM EDT.
* IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 437 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 0.5 and 1.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1.5 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Mount Sterling, Owingsville, Jeffersonville, Camargo, Salt Lick, Peeled Oak, Stepstone, Howards Mill, Walkers Crossing, Kendall Springs, Oggs Station, Crooks, Lower Spencer, Upper Spencer, Preston, Hope, Coons Station, Bourbon Furnace, Gatewoods Station and Ewington.
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 745 PM EDT THIS EVENING
